column2: WYOMING DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Wyoming
column6: WY

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column6: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 2. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Intersection ahead
column6: Merging traffic from the right
column8: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 4. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.

column2: 5. Drinking alcohol:
column4: has no effect on driving ability but affects your judgement.
column6: harms both judgement and driving skills.
column8: has no effect on either judgement or driving  ability.

column2: 6. The golden rule of driving is to:
column4: treat others the way you want to be treated.
column6: drive faster than the vehicle behind you.
column8: put on your emergency flashers when driving at night.

column2: 7. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.

column2: 8. To see vehicles in your blind spots, you must look:
column4: over your shoulders.
column6: in your outside rearview mirror.
column8: in your side mirrors.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Winding Road Ahead
column6: Persons with Disabilities Parking
column8: Merge

column2: 10. Night driving can be more difficult because:
column4: vehicle speed and distance are harder to judge.
column6: there are more cars on the roads at night.
column8: the speed limit is increased at night.

column2: 11. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.

column2: 12. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: taking a cold shower.
column6: waiting several hours.
column8: getting a cup of coffee.

column2: 13. Which of the following road surfaces freezes first when wet?
column4: Tunnels.
column6: Bridges and overpasses.
column8: Roundabouts.

column2: 14. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: increase your following distance.
column6: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column8: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 15. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.
column6: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column8: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 16. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly.
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.
column8: pump the brakes rapidly.

column2: 17. When merging onto an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: turn on their emergency flashers right before merging.
column6: always stop before entering the highway.
column8: select a safe gap and merge into the lane of traffic.

column2: 18. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column6: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
column8: signal and pull into the slow lane.

column2: 19. Speed limit signs are:
column4: service signs
column6: regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column8: warning signs

column2: 20. Where must you position your vehicle when you prepare to make a left turn from a two-way roadway into a one-way roadway?
column4: On the right curb.
column6: As close as possible to the center line.
column8: As far to the right as possible.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for trucks entering from the side
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Steep hill

column2: 22. You should always travel:
column4: at the speed limit.
column6: according to weather and road conditions.
column8: at the speed of the vehicle behind.

column2: 23. This is:
column4: a side road sign.
column6: a right curve sign.
column8: a merging traffic sign.

column2: 24. If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim the lights, you should look:
column4: toward the right side of the road.
column6: toward the center of the roadway.
column8: straight ahead.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Warning, crossroad ahead
column6: All traffic must turn
column8: Yield sign ahead

column2: 26. If a tire blows out, drivers should:
column4: hold the steering wheel tightly and use the brakes lightly.
column6: pull over quickly.
column8: apply the brake firmly and hold it.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: Warning, curves ahead
column6: Slippery when wet
column8: Do not use your brakes in this area

column2: 28. This signal means:
column4: Move to the left
column6: Slow down
column8: Stop

column2: 29. Driver distractions include:
column4: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column6: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.
column8: Avoiding unnecessary lane changes.

column2: 30. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column6: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.
column8: talk on your cell phone while driving.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Flagger ahead
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 32. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Upside-down triangle
column6: Vertical rectangle
column8: Diamond

column2: 33. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column6: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column8: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: One-way street ahead
column6: Turn left or go through
column8: No right turn

column2: 35. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 36. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Service signs
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)
column8: Warning signs

column2: 37. Sudden wind gusts on highways:
column4: are generally caused by dust and dirt blowing around.
column6: only affect large vehicles.
column8: can cause one to lose control of their vehicle.

column2: 38. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: Keep left
column6: Divided highway begins
column8: Lane ends

column2: 40. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: try to pass close behind.

column2: 41. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: must obey
column6: are less important than
column8: take precedence over

column2: 42. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column6: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 43. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a cross road.
column6: a side road.
column8: a sharp turn.

column2: 44. When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
column4: using the inside mirror.
column6: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.
column8: using both the inside and outside mirrors.

column2: 45. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: help you to be a better driver.
column6: impair your judgment.
column8: make you feel better.

column2: 46. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from both directions.
column6: vehicles from the left.
column8: vehicles from the right.

column2: 47. Vehicles stopped behind a school bus when the red lights are flashing must remain stopped until:
column4: all students are off the bus.
column6: the stop arm is retracted and the bus begins moving.
column8: the flashing lights turn green.

column2: 48. When you see a "merging traffic" sign on the freeway, you should:
column4: speed up to avoid congesting traffic.
column6: slow down to allow traffic to enter.
column8: move to another lane to let traffic enter, if safe.

column2: 49. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column4: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column6: change lanes abruptly.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 50. A yellow arrow on a traffic signal means:
column4: Be prepared to stop and give the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles.
column6: Drivers are not required to signal before turning from that lane.
column8: Increase your speed to make the turn before the light changes.
